column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

With continuing wet weather in the major supply district Roma Agents yarded 2196 head. All the regular processors feedlotters and backgrounders present and active. The market improved for all categories.

Yearling steers under 200kg topped 490c/kg. Yearling steers 200 to 280kg with the majority selling from 380c to 468c/kg for better pens. Yearling steers 280 to 330kg sold to 462c to restockers to average 436c/kg. Yearling steers 330 to 400kg made to 422c to feed and 432c/kg to restockers. Yearling steers 400 to 480kg topped 414c to feed. Yearling steers over 480kg sold to 382c/kg to processors.

Heifers also improved 200 to 280kg sold to 312c to processors and 368c/kg to restockers. Yearling heifers 280 to 330kg made to 382c and averaged 348c/kg to restockers. Yearling heifers 330 to 400kg also sold well and made from 310c to 382c/kg. Yearling heifers 400 to 480kg only small offering and sold to 360c/kg to feed.

Grown steers 500 to 600kg made to 392c/kg to processors. Bullocks over 600kg topped 374c/kg also to processors. Grown heifers over 540kg improved in price and made to 360c/kg. Cows numbers were low compared to other weeks. The 2 score cows 400 to 520kg sold from 202c to 270c/kg. The 3 score cows improved considerably with cows over 520kg topping 314c with heavy older heifers topping 350c/kg to processors. Bulls over 600kg sold to 323c/kg.

Market Reporter David Friend.
